item.description:
10/12 UPDATE: Tickets have been purchased for the show next Wednesday! We have 12 people attending so this should be a good chance to meet some new faces and socialize, while having some laughs along the way. Walking around the North End on Wednesday night I realized it's a little bit of a walk from the restaurant, Ducali's, to the Improv. Google Maps shows it as .4 miles / about an 8 minutes walk. The forecast for Wednesday looks to be clear skies, with a low of 48. Hopefully a pleasant evening for a stroll through the North End.

Dinner: Ducali Pizzeria and Bar in the North End http://ducalipizza.com/. Please arrive no later than 6 pm.  I'll be at the restaurant at 5:30 and will have a Meetup sign. We should plan to leave by about 7:15 for the Improv. Ducali does take credit cards and are willing to do individual checks. For anyone interested, after the show we can check out one of the many cafe's in the North End for a pastry or gelato. When you get to Ducali's, please ask for me or look for the red Meetup sign I'll have at our table.


Parking: http://www.north-end-boston.com/1273/Parking_Garages.  You may also be lucky enough to find on street parking, but please check the related signs as some meters in Boston require payment until 8 pm.

T: Haymarket or North Station stops

Show: The Improv Asylum Address: 216 Hanover Street, Boston, MA 02113
Phone: (617) 263-6887. The Improv serves beer and wine.

I will send contact information on Wednesday morning in case there are any last minute questions and you need to reach me.

 

The Improv Asylum Vanity Project

October 17, 2012 (8:00PM)

Improv Asylum founders/original cast members Chet Harding and Norm Laviolette join main stage actors Jeremy Brothersand Matt Catanzano, as well as alums and special guests to perform two extended sets of anything-goes, hilarious longform improvisation. Vanity Project . . . egos will be stroked.
item.name: Pizza Then the Improv Asylum in the North End
